Sentencas: The effect of applied potential on the selective oxidation of methane in a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC)-type reactor was investigated.
Titulo: Selective oxidation of methane in an SOFC-type reactor: effect of applied potential

Sentencas: A tube-type YSZ was used as an electrolyte where a La1.8Al0.2O3 anode and a conventional La0.85Sr0.15MnO3 cathode were deposited on the inner and outer surfaces of the tube, respectively.
Titulo: Selective oxidation of methane in an SOFC-type reactor: effect of applied potential

Sentencas: The fuel cell-type temperature-programmed desorption (FC-TPD) measurements revealed that the amount of adsorbed oxygen on the anode catalyst was altered with the applied potential.
Titulo: Selective oxidation of methane in an SOFC-type reactor: effect of applied potential

Sentencas: Increasing the applied potential increased the amount of weakly adsorbed oxygen at the oxygenate site.
Titulo: Selective oxidation of methane in an SOFC-type reactor: effect of applied potential

Sentencas: Two operating modes of the SOFC-type reactor were carried out.
Titulo: Selective oxidation of methane in an SOFC-type reactor: effect of applied potential

Sentencas: In the normal mode, it was found that the rate Of C-2 formation was not affected by an applied potential.
Titulo: Selective oxidation of methane in an SOFC-type reactor: effect of applied potential

Sentencas: The positive potential increased the rate of carbon oxides formation, especially the product CO, while the negative potential suppressed the rates of CO and CO2 formation.
Titulo: Selective oxidation of methane in an SOFC-type reactor: effect of applied potential

Sentencas: For the mixed-flow mode, even though the electrochemically promoted rates did not show significant improvement over the open-circuit rates, the catalytic activities of the anode catalyst to different products were altered by the applied potential with non-Faradaic manner.
Titulo: Selective oxidation of methane in an SOFC-type reactor: effect of applied potential

Sentencas: The change in the selectivity of the active site gave a new aspect to non-Faradaic electrochemical modification of catalytic activity (NEMCA) phenomena.
Titulo: Selective oxidation of methane in an SOFC-type reactor: effect of applied potential
